Reviews.Title: Great TV/ Great Price
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice TV at a nice pricepoint at $598. The picture quality and audio quality are both above my expectations. Barely anyone can tell the difference between 60Hz and 120 Hz, and I don't feel that paying the extra is worth any more in picture quality. Vizio is a quality company, based in California. This TV is to replace a Samsung 52 in LCD that stopped working (flickering continuously on-off) in past weeks. From a quick look at Samsung at online forums, it seems all models of Samsung are prone to this type of failure, and I simply did not want to go back to a company that disappointed me. A TV should last until you are ready to replace it with a new one.As for this not being a Smart TV, it is pretty clear it is not a Smart TV from doing your due diligence beforehand. Regardless, I look at the new technology of smart TV's as just another useless addition that increases the chance of it failing prematurely. This is a great TV if you don't need the Smart TV option.Overall, it is a quality TV. No complaintsSam

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Ed Kelety
Reviews.Content: TV was delivered, unpacked, tested and has been used for the last several weeks. It's a no-frills TV that won't arrange for videoconferencing or allow you to do email, but will enable you to watch TV, period. Multiple HDMI ports on the back, one RGB port. Works well.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  It has an excellent picture and generally good sound.  For sports and all around TV is performs very well. I also like the price and the fact that Vizio is based in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: Want to make that 4 1/2 stars, as there is only one flaw so far.
Reviews.Author: odin4905
Reviews.Content: I ordered one of these, and the first one had some bulb issues or something after around 20 days. There were white lines being made down the left side of the screen. I got it replaced and so far the new one hasn't done that, but I don't think it has been 20 days yet.However, it does have one issue. The bottom 1/5th of the screen flickers. Certain colors make this more apparent. Blue seems to make it most obvious. So far, this doesn't really bother me, but if it gets worse I may have a problem. The first TV that I replaced did NOT have this new ones problem, so it seems that there are a variety of issues this TV may have, but I figure that's the price of paying less for a great TV.Other than this the TV more than meets my expectations and as long as it doesn't get worse I will keep it and enjoy it, knowing it is well worth the price.EDIT 2/12/2013The problem DID indeed get a bit worse, so I am returning and trying yet again, hoping the next one has no issues, at least for the month I'm allowed to return it in. Geez, hope nothing happens after that period with next one. I really don't want to try any other kind of TV, as this one has the picture I want, when it works perfectly haha. PLEASE make this exchange the last. :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Ntrain2k
Reviews.Content: Good price and great picture and sound quality. Delivered when it was supposed to be. Upgraded from a 42" to this and though is seems like a small upgrade it turned out to be a BIG one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Price
Reviews.Author: rwbig
Reviews.Content: Researched for months and decided on this Vizio TV... I was not disappointed! Great picture, features. Sound was a little dull so with a $100 Vizio sound bar it was great! I don't think it can be beat for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: WE LOVE VIZIO!
Reviews.Author: londonliz38 "liz"
Reviews.Content: This is an EXCELLENT tv for the price. It is HUGE! The picture is so crisp and clean and the colors just POP!. The sound is excellent. My husband and I purchased this brand because we had a 32" VIZIO when they first came out about 6 years ago. It was a flat screen when flat screens first were becoming popular. To this day, that 32" television is WONDERFUL. Just as crisp and great sounding as when we first purchased it. We chose to buy a 50" to upgrade our tv to a bigger size. We couldn't have asked for a better prouct. I highly recommend VIZIO  to anyone wanting a wonderful. television at a great price.The delivery company that Amazon used were very professional. The men brought the televsion in and removed it from the box, set it up for me and made sure it was in good working order before leaving.  I was able to connect my HDMI cables and my cable box with no trouble at all.I called VIZIO  to register my television and ask a few tech questions and the gal I spoke with was very helpful, knowledgable and extremely friendly and customer service oritented. Top shelf company to do business with. We will continue to purchase VIZIO products.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Janis M. Weems "Always Searching"
Reviews.Content: We just love everything about this Vizio tv.  All the good things I read and heard about it turned out to be right-on the mark.  The picture is clear, without being 'too bright'.  We had struggled between getting an LED/LCD or an LCD, and we feel we chose right (for us).  We did a lot of homework before getting this particular tv, and we feel that this was the perfect choice.  I would recommend this highly for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Ultimateness...
Reviews.Author: Brett Weir
Reviews.Content: I was looking at different brands, but apparently this one got high reviews in Consumer Reports. It's awesome in every way. I have it hooked up to a blu-ray player via HDMI, and the picture is even better than awesome. IT IS ULTIMATE SAUCE.I just watched "Dredd" on blu-ray and freaked myself right out.Note: I recommend keeping the picture setting on "Vivid," as it's very bright and versatile.

Reviews.Title: Nice so far.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Wells
Reviews.Content: I got the TV last month and had to adjust many of the automatic picture features and tint to get it to look good. Then every time I shut the TV off, it would not remember the settings. So, I called the company and a Vizio AMERICAN based representative helped me reset the TV and it was all fixed. Since then I discovered that the problem was really my cables.  Although, even with my older bad cables I could still adjust it to a decent picture, it now looks really good even with my old DVD player, VCR and composite WII input.  However, I would be careful not to buy this one for a small room unless you are going all HD, because it will probably look a little grainy.  My room is fairly large and so I have no issues with this, I could just see it being a problem for some if you are too close to it. Although, with HD it looks awesome all around.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E500AR 50-inch 1080p 60Hz HDTV
Reviews.Author: Colorado Joanne
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio so I knew what to expect.  Really good picture and a good price.  Had one glitch --the remote would not work.  I called Vizio and they helped me re-program it.  All was solved in 5 minutes and the rest was easy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I am very please with my TV. It came as scheduled and has a good picture. The price was one of the best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: WE LOVE OUR VIZIO
Reviews.Author: L. cline
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV!  We love the picture and the screen size is perfect for our master bedroom.  I would recommend this to anyone and the price could not be beat!  We also got free shipping with our Prime account.

Reviews.Title: Great picture for the price
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I have owned this product for about a month and I feel that this TV has a really good picture for the price.  Has low glare, and gaming works great!  I wish that it had another AV input as I can't hook up my older Xbox 360 (which uses component input) and my DVD player at the same time.  I guess I'll just have to invest in a blue ray player.

Reviews.Title: great tv for price
Reviews.Author: Patrick Moran
Reviews.Content: great picture, some functions take time getting use too but overall a pleasure watching this tv, a little better picture than my vizio 47 that it replaced

Reviews.Title: Great TV and a fantastic price
Reviews.Author: Eileen C
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV.  for my husband to watch sports, mainly.  He loves it.  I am very pleased with picture quality.  Easy set up, too.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying every minute
Reviews.Author: CLE ANNA TATMAN HOQUE
Reviews.Content: I love the picture..very very nice ..quality is superb..easy to operate..sound is also very nice..can't wait to order another one for my bedroom

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV just great
Reviews.Author: victoria E. Nealis
Reviews.Content: I think the ;picture quality for the size of the tv is pretty good.It has met all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: 50" vizio
Reviews.Author: freewater
Reviews.Content: our whole family has bouth this brand of lcd hdtv, the picture is vibrant and clear, sound is great!  Its a great TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Diane Rogers
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV because the clarity is amazing and the set up was effortless for someone who struggles with technology set ups!. I LOVED having this TV delivered right to my home and the gentlemen put it together and cleaned everything up. I will definitely order from Amazon again. You can always go into the stores and research your product and come home and order it from Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture and Colors Good Sound by TV standards.
Reviews.Author: Medium Level Tech
Reviews.Content: This is our third Vizio TV and they keep getting better.  This replaced a 37 inch 720p and it is amazing how much sharper and cleared the image is, and we thought the old TV was great.The sound is good by TV standards but we wanted to add surround sound.  We called Vizio support (which also registered out warranty at the time) and discussed options.  They did not push their upper end product and explained to us the different numerical designations.  We decided that a 40" 2.0 would work in our medium sized apartment.  That review will be coming soon.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: Susan B. Kalergis "skalergis"
Reviews.Content: I bought a small vizio for my mother and really liked it. Was inexpensive, but still good quality. So decided to purchase a 50" for ourselves. Was very disappointed. The audio is horrible, very muffled and the picture quality and color are bad as well. We have sent it back and rehooking up our 9 year old Panasonic which is far superior.

Reviews.Title: Worked for less than two months
Reviews.Author: Lee Nunley
Reviews.Content: Came home one day and the TV backlight didn't work anymore, now I have to deal with returning the TV to Vizio. It was nice while it worked.Recommended if you only need a TV for 6 weeks.

Reviews.Title: This is NOT a smart TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Vizio E500AR is NOT a smart TV, despite what the title states! (Title as of 11/19/12 states: VIZIO E500AR 50-inch 1080P Ambient Light Sensor 120Hz Smart LCD HDTV) The E502AR is a smart TV (note the single number difference in the model number - 500 vs 502), but somehow Amazon has the E500AR listed as a smart TV at the smart TV price (this used to be $598, now it's $679... hmmm). It was in my cart while I researched options and I was notified that the price increased... funny enough the price jumped from the $598 price for the 500, to $679 (which happens to be the price for the 502 on Vizio's website).Also, thanks to Amazon's incorrect listing title I accidently ordered the wrong one. When the price on this one jumped, I found it on another website (store that rhymes with ball mart) for what I thought was still the $598 price for the SMART tv. WRONG! It's NOT a smart TV, and now I have the hassle of returning this one and now I can't find the E502AR anywhere (after deeper searching it is out of stock at ball mart and Amazon only has the 500).IF YOU WANT A SMART TV THIS IS NOT IT! DON'T BE CONFUSED BY THE SIMILIAR ITEM NUMBERS AND DECEIVING ITEM TITLE! To get this same TV, but have it actually be a smart TV you need the 502. Check Vizio's website for all the differences (and good luck finding the 502!).Amazon, PLEASE correct this error. This TV should NOT be listed as a smart TV, and should only be $598. It seems whoever listed this is confused as well!From Vizio's website:The E500AR (NOT a smart TV) - [...]The E502AR  (IS a smart TV)- [...]

Reviews.Title: visio tv
Reviews.Author: rene cartier
Reviews.Content: way to much window glare on tv that we didnot have with last TV poor support they did not follow through with messaging as promised and when I told girl on support line about glare she said it wasnt a problem

Reviews.Title: NOT A SMART TV!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lorna
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed that I ordered, waited, received, set up TV and then discover it is NOT a smart tv! Advertised on Amazon as such....sheesh!!!! Item to be returned!!!!!!!11/24/12 Update: Amazon's customer service has been wonderful. They were apologetic and helpful. Because of their professionalism and ease of return process, I have now ordered the Vizio E502ar 50 inch that IS a smart tv. I called Amazon to verify this and they in turn, called Vizio to verify the information just to be sure. :)Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Content: LOL LOL LOL CALM DOWN BRO.This tv has great reviews on Wal-Mart.com, might pull the trigger on this tv soon.
